segments.text: But it's the White House . The president and his family live there.They won't let us see most of it . Probably we can only see a couple of rooms .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , that's not true.The White House is very big . And there are a lot of historical exhibits there.The tour will take us through many different rooms . I read about it in the guide .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hmm . If that's true , then the security there must be very good.Because it's strange to think they will let people walk around in the White House .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm sure the security is very tight.Probably they will make us walk through metal detectors like at the airport .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So I can't take my gun then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't always joke like that ! You don't have a gun .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You shouldn't say things like that . You could get arrested !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ? Do you think someone will arrest me for making a joke ? Someone will arrest me here at the breakfast table ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . But if you say something like that in the White House , they may take it seriously . Sometimes I think you joke too much .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'll be careful . Don't worry . I don't want to get arrested by the FBI.But how long does the White House tour last ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not sure . I think it lasts about one hour .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Alright . We should take a taxi over there right after breakfast .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: First I want to look in the travel guide.Maybe they don't have tours in the morning .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's a good idea . Do you want some more coffee ?
segments.speaker: S1
